16 dse econ 5**留名
有咩想問可以講

Longq成日答唔哂d pt

你要根據個logic flow 慢慢咁寫哂出黎。

你可以寫完每一點，問自己「跟住會點呢？」，諗下中間既因果係咪直接既，由題目比你既資訊（前提）慢慢推到去個結果度。

好多同學係見到data response questions都會覺得好難，但其實同一般題目既分別，就係包裝唔同，題目比你既前提唔係直接比你，而係透過一d source，根本上係無太大分別既。你要做既野只係多一步。以下係一個示範：

Source A:
The Japanese Prime Minister Abe Shinzō implemented economic stimulus measures in 2012, with the aim of achieving a target of 2% inflation in 2 years. The following 3 aspects are included:

1. Quantitative easing monetary policy: by open market operations, Bank of Japan buy and hold bonds to devaluate the Japanese yen, so exports and consumption can be boosted.

2. Increase expenditures: the government increases the budget for building public infrastructure in Japan.

3. Structural economic reforms: structural reforms tackle issues including serious aging population. Done by encouraging re-employment of married women (who used to give up their career upon marriage), and relaxing stringent immigration policies.


Source B
Assuming that monetary easing increases the contents of the people’s wallets from 10,000 yen to 20,00 yen, they will spend more readily. Companies will earn more, so will their staff. This way, Japan can free
itself from the long-running deflation and realise economic growth.
— quoted from a professor in the US


Source C
Haruhiko Kuroda, Governor of the Japanese Central Bank, said that while the recent oil price drops would benefit the Japanese economy, it would also suppress inflation growth. He stresses that Japan has an adjustable timetable in reaching its 2% inflation target, and the time required will depend on international oil prices. He believes that the growth in Japan’s consumer price index (CPI) may slow down for a time.


Source D
With Japan’s economic depression, “Abenomics” may need adjustments
Recently economists have lowered projections of Japan’s GDP in the 2nd quarter of 2015. The International Monetary Fund (IMF) points out that it is not an appropriate measure for Japan to rely heavily on the quantitative easing monetary policy, as it might weaken the demand for domestic expenditure. Also, stimulating export through devaluating the yen may
inspire other nations to follow, that is, to raise their competitiveness through currency devaluation.


Source E

Questions:

1. Use economics theories and with the aid of source B, explain why quantitative easing monetary policy may help free Japan from deflation in the short term, and realize economic growth. (3 marks)

2. Referring to Sources A and C, with the use of an AD-AS diagram, explain why Japan may may fail to achieve its aim of 2% inflation through the quantitative easing monetary policy. (8 marks)

3. According to source D, explain whether the devaluation of the Japanese yen will necessarily improve export. (4 marks)

4. Referring to Source E, and without using diagrams, explain how the change in Japan’s elderly population percentage will affect the nation’s output. (3 marks)

5. “Japan’s economic stimulus policy is only short term and not a sustainable and effective measure”. With the use of all the sources and your own economics, evaluate the above statement. (8 marks)

以上係其中一條示範，係edb個邊publish既sample，大家可以諗下點答，我聽日會post ans同埋思考方法。

留意點樣可以generalize and interpret個source，黎得到自己要既「前提」。

如果大家有反應既，去到DSE之前都會share呢d大家覺得難既野。


好重要既野
Source of the question:
Resource Pack on Economics Data-response Question, published by Education Bureau in 2016.

Question has been edited.

搵(a)做個example先，題目叫你refer to source B, 咁你要既野就一定係入面搵啦，呢D大家通識都做唔少架啦。我地睇source B：

“Assuming that monetary easing increases the contents of the people’s wallets from 10,000 yen to 20,00 yen, they will spend more readily. Companies will earn more, so will their staff. This way, Japan can free itself from the long-running deflation and realise economic growth.”

咁咩係QE？原來要睇番source 1:
"Quantitative easing monetary policy: through open market operations by the Bank of Japan, buy and hold national bonds..."

你一見到OMO，你會諗到係central bank 買／賣bond，而家個source B話埋你聽係buy/hold bonds，你應該會即刻知道同MS有關：buy bonds Ms increases，咁有咩同money market 最大關係？無錯，係interest rate：Ms increases interest rate drops。再推落去，咩同interest rate decrease有關？就係C同I，因為個cost of borrowing 低左，你想借多左錢去買野，投資。最後一步就梗係AD會跟住升，然後P，Y都升啦。呢個就係一個完整既邏輯推論（logical deduction）

有一d同學可能諗到quantity theory of money，用呢個做推理一樣可以。

如果你直接抄個source，唔會有分。

佢有機會出返comparative advantage既野，呢d送分咁滯，呢幾年都有要求畫curve，要知道唔同情況點畫（constant cost, increasing cost），識睇識畫就拎到一半分以上
基本上都係8-12分comparative advantage+ppf curve同埋4-8分HDI
HDI就年年問法差唔多

science人

都岩既

The Federal Reserve (the "Fed") increased the target rate of federal funds by 0.25% in December 2016. Which of the following will happen in the Hong Kong economy as a result?

A) Hong Kong Inter-bank Offered Rate (HIBOR) will increase by 0.25%.

B) More Investments will be made in Hong Kong as the discount rate in Hong Kong will most likely to increase by 0.25%.

C) Imports from the US may decrease due to the appreciation of USD against HKD.

D) As the cost of borrowing in Hong Kong will increase, under Linked Exchange Rate system, less investment will be made in Hong Kong.

請出招
Dse考埋聯儲嘅咩

出過題

1. Currently, the economy is at long-run equilibrium. Which of the following will cause an inflationary gap?

A) an increase in consumer taxes
B) an increase in minimum wage
C) a reduction in government expenditure
D) a reduction in import volume

2. Tap&Go is one of the prepaid MasterCard service providers. Users are able to save their money into their cards and use them in the future. Which of the function of money have been demonstrated by these prepaid MasterCards?

i) Medium of exchange;
ii) Measurement of value;
iii) Standard of deferred payments;
iv) Storage of value;

A) (i) only
B) (i), (ii) only
C) (i), (iii), (iv) only
D) (iv) only

20號考完hist先開始溫點睇
主科都未搞掂
有4就滿足

出過題

1. Currently, the economy is at long-run equilibrium. Which of the following will cause an inflationary gap?

A) an increase in consumer taxes
B) an increase in minimum wage
C) a reduction in government expenditure
D) a reduction in import volume

2. Tap&Go is one of the prepaid MasterCard service providers. Users are able to save their money into their cards and use them in the future. Which of the function of money have been demonstrated by these prepaid MasterCards?

i) Medium of exchange;
ii) Measurement of value;
iii) Standard of deferred payments;
iv) Storage of value;

A) (i) only
B) (i), (ii) only
C) (i), (iii), (iv) only
D) (iv) only

master card 唔係定，我諗比錢唔係比張卡人，所以唔係Medium of exchange同Standard of deferred payments

B) an increase in minimum wage

i) Medium of exchange;
ii) Measurement of value;
iii) Standard of deferred payments;
iv) Storage of value;

A) (i) only
B) (i), (ii) only
C) (i), (iii), (iv) only
D) (iv) only

D A

1. Currently, the economy is at long-run equilibrium. Which of the following will cause an inflationary gap?

Medium of exchange: facilitate buying and selling
Means of payment: bill/debts are settled

你講既比錢係means of payment

交易的媒介
Medium of Exchange
交易是透過貨幣，以貨幣作為賣買雙方的交易工具，解決了欠缺雙重需求偶合的問題。

計算的單位
Unit of Account
以貨幣的單位計算物品的價值。牛是二千元，任何人直接用二千便可以與他交給牛，不用再計算物品與物品之間的交易比率。

儲存價值
Store of Value
貨幣可以儲存起來，留待有需要之時才使用。

延期支付的標準
Standard for deferred payment
由於貨幣可以有儲存價值，對於一些將來結算的事，都可以以貨幣作單位來計算。

問個問題
樓價急劇下降點影響 總需求 總供應？

AD會跌
http://www.edb.gov.hk/attachment/en/curriculum-development/kla/pshe/references-and-resources/economics/housing_eng.docx

2.1. Wealth Effect
● Increasing housing prices will create a positive wealth effect. It leads to a higher amount of consumption by consumers. Since properties are parts of personal wealth, an increase in the property price will add to the wealth of property owners. Property owners can then spend more on non-housing items when they realize that their net wealth is increased. Hence, such wealth effects due to the increase in property value will positively influence the consumption expenditure of the aggregate demand.

2.2. Effects of Property Price Fluctuations on Macroeconomic Performances through Financial Market
● Financial institutions provide loans to property owners through different refinancing schemes. Property owners can spend money through refinancing schemes when the property price is rising. Hence, it has a positive impact on the consumption component in its aggregate demand.

2.3. Bank Balance Sheet Effect
● To maximise the amount of loans a borrower can acquire from the bank, many small to medium size enterprises use their commercial or personal properties as securities or collateral. Banks rely on securities to reduce the risk of money lending because the borrowers often have better information about their ability to repay their loans (i.e. the problem of asymmetric information exists). Higher valuation of the secured properties has two effects. First, it increases the amount of loans that the enterprises can acquire. Second, it raises the bank’s ability to lend. In turn, the enterprises can use the borrowed money for investment. This will bring about a positive effect on the component of investment in the aggregate demand.

溫marking有用，但唔好依賴，你見到每年寫既野都有d唔同，比分位更加唔會一樣。

最緊要寫翻哂d邏輯推理出黎，不停問自己"跟住會點"，逐步逐步寫。

aim高更加唔好死背marking既比分位，點比分可寬可緊，唔好諗住4分就寫4句 ，有時可以寫多過一個pt先有分。寫翻所有steps就得，d分點allocate都唔關你事(當然你唔好寫篇essay)。

有呀 點樣可以寫野中point 係咪溫marking scheme?成日卷個陣又唔係唔識 睇翻ans只係有小小岀入但大概想講既野差唔多


你aim咩？

溫marking有用，但唔好依賴，你見到每年寫既野都有d唔同，比分位更加唔會一樣。

最緊要寫翻哂d邏輯推理出黎，不停問自己"跟住會點"，逐步逐步寫。

aim高更加唔好死背marking既比分位，點比分可寬可緊，唔好諗住4分就寫4句 ，有時可以寫多過一個pt先有分。寫翻所有steps就得，d分點allocate都唔關你事(當然你唔好寫篇essay)。

Aim 4咋 依家得3

咪撚睇marking呀 年年比分位唔同 唔好見到啲題目同邊年邊題似樣就衝出黎柒 人地轉少少野答案可以唔同 econ最緊要答番個flow出黎
例如 答案係increase in AD就寫埋increase in C/I/G/NX先 你永遠唔知佢究竟點比分

即係U得啦

BA就可以睇下marking既 睇下人地答案個flow係點 可以你地學校老師教既presentation方法同marking唔同 可以既話就跟番marking
例如 accountJJ既 Costing同CVP analysis 最好就睇下marking點答 因為佢地既marking一定係最方面marker睇既官方答案 你跟足個frame marker都睇得易啲 自己做又易哂
